name: Hotel Windsor Nice

reviews.text: I stayed in the Hotel Windsor for two nights in September, 2006. It was clean, and the staff was pleasant and helpful. The location of the hotel is excellent, just a few blocks from the beachfront and within easy walking distance of all center city attractions. The hotel could use a bit of a facelift. Although the bathrooms have been somewhat modernized, the rooms are a bit shabby. There is a lovely outdoor garden and pool area, but it needs a good cleaning. At all costs, avoid the overpriced and unappetizing breakfast served in the garden that needs a good cleaning.
reviews.title: Disappointing

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2006, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Very pleasant hotel in good location just a short walk from the beach and good restaurants. The staff are wonderful and welcoming and all seem to be bi-lingual. There is a very pleasant garden where breakfast was taken, the quality of which was excellent. I would stay here again but not unless I could afford to up-grade to a larger room on the quieter garden side.
reviews.title: Clean and convenient.

reviews.text: This is obviously a well loved hotel and well maintained with many interesting features. All the public areas and our room were kept spotlessly clean.
reviews.title: A tropical paradise!!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2006, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: On the negative side our standard twin room, decorated by a local artist, was very interesting but sadly not the most comfortable functional room and it was beginning to look a little tired. There was absolutely nowhere to put anything and I think in future I would prefer a more boring standard room with the odd drawer so I could unpack my case, and also a bedside table for my book etc. also there was nowhere to sit . Both beds were pushed up against the wall and both were rather uncomfortable. The bathroom was very modern with an excellent shower.
reviews.title: Charming and very special!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2006, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: I would certainly consider going to this hotel again but would need to know what type of bedroom I was going to get!
reviews.title: right up to expectations

reviews.text: I took my wife to Nice for a suprise for her 30th birthday, and after hours of searching on trip advisor, finally chose Hotel Windsor based on the reviews on this site. I had email correspondance with the front desk at the hotel and on our arrival they had my emails printed out and had highlighted my requests, all of which had been done. Like so many other reviews on this site, i must say the desk staff are exceptional! They are all so very friendly, helpful, speak great english (my french is terrible) and are always smiling!
reviews.title: Great Stay, perfect base for Nice
A Perfect Weekend Break
reviews.text: The room we had overlooked the garden/pool, it was good standard, it was ideal for me and my wife and the bed was one of the best we've slept in!! The hotel has many quirky features (lift, gym come chill out room upstairs.....visit and you will understand). As for location, it is excellent, so close to the promenade anglais and old town. On the whole i can safely say i would recommend this hotel to anyone and will return ourselves.

My wife and I chose the Windsor Hotel based on the reviews given. I found the reviews to be very accurate. The hotel is well placed for the Promenade and the Old Town. The room that I chose overlooked the garden and was relatively quiet and was a 3-4* standard. We ate breakfast in the hotel and the choice was adequate but llimited as stated by other travellers.
reviews.title: Plesantly surprised
Nice but noisy!
reviews.text: We had marvellous weather on all 4 days we were there and as a result we utilised the private beach of Sporting for which you can get tokens at the hotel desk. You still have to pay to use the beach, but the facilities there are quite good.

reviews.title: Full of character and charm, close to sea front
reviews.text: The only downside to the stay was the complete lack of choice for Vegetarian meals for my wife. After much searching we found La Zucca Magica in the Port area which is 100% vegetarian. It was packed out (so there is an obvious demand) , but we were lucky to get a table. Unfortunately it closes on a Sunday and Monday night. We also ate at 11e Art (11 rue Meyerbeer) and at Barracuda (2 rue Meyerbeer) both of which were of a good standard.

The Hotel Windsor was a funny little hotel! My mother and I travelled through France and Italy for 3 weeks and this was our 2nd stop. The hotel had everything we needed, including an elevator and free internet access. The Windsor was close to everything in Nice....all the shopping, restaurants and the sea!
reviews.title: Quirky, but great!

reviews.text: The staff were really exceptional and ALWAYS had a smile on their face. I'd say they were the nicest staff we had all through out Europe.
reviews.title: Nice in Nice...

reviews.text: The rooms are a little outdate, but, we really like the hotel overall. If you go in the summer, there is a pool and a beautiful courtyard, which is great in this city of buildings.
reviews.title: Charming Hotel, Great Service, Cute Pool, Perfect Location

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2006, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: I would recommend this hotel for the price!
reviews.title: Fabulous and unique

likes.disliked: — Dine in the garden if there is a special meal/event

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2006, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Stayed here over the weekend of 10-12 November 2006.
reviews.title: A fantastic gem in Nice

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2006, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The hotel isn't bad for the price, but I would've upgraded. We had the standard room - which we thought needed updating. We didn't think the bed sheets and carpet were too clean. Other than that, it was blocks away from the rocky beaches and great restaurants.
reviews.title: Ok, not bad

likes.disliked: — the standard room didn't seem clean, maybe the superior might be better

reviews.title: great little gem !
reviews.text: We stayed at the Hotel Windsor in July 2006 for 6 nights. Had a great "artist" room overlooking the gardens. Price at 150 euros was fair and a great breakfast delivered to our room (you can have it also in the lovely garden which also has a swimming pool.). Staff friendly and only there when you need them. Highly recommended !

We had a great stay in this hotel. The location was perfect ... just minutes from anywhere in Nice. However - our stay was very short as we were just stopping off for one night on our way somewhere else ... and as it was incredibly hot we ended up just chilling by the pool and chatting in the lovely garden.
reviews.title: Perfect base to explore Nice

reviews.text: The rooms were really interesting as well as being clean and well decorated. I particularly enjoyed the lift ... but I'll leave that as a suprise for your visit.
reviews.title: Great Stay at the Hotel Windsor!

reviews.text: Definitely would stay here again if I was in Nice.
reviews.title: Shame about the rats and ants

description: Charming hotel with secluded garden, in the city center, next to the Promenade des Anglais and not far from the train station. 30 rooms designed by contemporary artist, other rooms with frescoes more traditional. Exhibition in the lobby. Fresh ans traditional cooking, Spa with steambath, massages and body treatments.
